articles.title: Facial recognition police use 'ramp up' as privacy campaigners warn of 'chilling effect' from Orwellian tech
articles.description: The Government has launched a consultation that will ask for views on how the technology should be regulated
articles.content:
The Government has launched a consultation that will ask for views on how the technology should be regulated and how to protect people's privacy.
The Government is also proposing to create a regulator to oversee police use of facial recognition, biom... [5154 chars]

articles.title: Little Rock board votes against public transparency on police use of surveillance tech
articles.description: The Little Rock Board of Directors rejected an ordinance that would have shed light on the Little Rock Police Department’s use of surveillance technology.
articles.content:
The Little Rock Board of Directors rejected an ordinance that would have shed light on the Little Rock Police Department’s use of surveillance technology at a meeting on Tuesday.
Sponsored by At-Large Director Antwan Phillips, the ordinance would hav... [10412 chars]

articles.title: British police to ramp up facial recognition to catch criminals
articles.description: LONDON, Dec 4 - Use of facial recognition technology will be expanded across Britain's police forces to help track down criminals, the government said on Thursday, as it proposed a new body to oversee its use. Read more at straitstimes.com.
articles.content:
LONDON, Dec 4 - Use of facial recognition technology will be expanded across Britain's police forces to help track down criminals, the government said on Thursday, as it proposed a new body to oversee its use.
The technology is already used by London... [2190 chars]

articles.title: Citadel Debuts New AI Tool For Equities Investors
articles.description: Citadel, the hedge fund founded by billionaire Ken Griffin, has launched a new artificial intelligence-powered tool that aims to help investors conduct research on stocks faster and more efficiently, the firm's chief technology officer said.
articles.content: Citadel, the hedge fund founded by billionaire Ken Griffin, has launched a new artificial intelligence-powered tool that aims to help investors conduct research on stocks faster and more efficiently, the firm's chief technology officer said on Wednes... [1468 chars]

articles.title: British police to ramp up facial recognition to catch criminals
articles.description: Use of facial recognition technology will be expanded across Britain's police forces to help track down criminals, the government said on Thursday, as it proposed a new body to oversee its use.
articles.content:
LONDON, Dec 4 (Reuters) - Use of facial recognition technology will be expanded across Britain's police forces to help track down criminals, the government said on Thursday, as it proposed a new body to oversee its use.
The technology is already used... [2206 chars]

articles.title: Facial recognition tech could be expanded for police across the UK
articles.description: A public consultation on facial recognition is set to begin after trials have seen police in places such as London use the technology.
articles.content:
Police could see a boost in powers under facial recognition technology plans touted by the government as the ‘biggest breakthrough for catching criminals since DNA matching’.
Facial recognition has been used to snare violent criminals and find missin... [4823 chars]

articles.title: Police could use passport photos in facial recognition roll-out
articles.description: Live images captured by police cameras could also be run through the driving licence database as the government paves the way for nationwide use of the technology
articles.content:
On Thursday the government will launch a ten-week consultation which will result in a legal framework for the uniform use of biometric technologies such as facial recognition.
Police already have the power to request access to passport and immigratio... [3282 chars]

articles.title: Philips reiterates timing of 2026 outlook
articles.description: December 4, 2025 Amsterdam, the Netherlands – Royal Philips (NYSE: PHG, AEX: PHIA), a global leader in health technology, today reaffirmed that its 2026...
articles.content:
December 4, 2025
Amsterdam, the Netherlands – Royal Philips (NYSE: PHG, AEX: PHIA), a global leader in health technology, today reaffirmed that its 2026 outlook will be issued as planned on February 10, in line with the company’s previously communica... [1993 chars]

articles.title: IIT Bombay study shows how TB bacteria shield themselves from antibiotics, stay alive longer
articles.description: the bacteria mycobacterium tuberculosis, which causes the world’s most infectious disease tuberculosis (tb), can survive antibiotic treatment and live longer by changing their outer fat coating, according to a new study led by researchers from the indian institute of technology (iit) bombay on wednesday. even with effective antibiotics and widespread vaccination campaigns, tb continues to take lives. globally, 10.7 million people developed tb and 1.23 million died from the disease in 2024, while india carri
articles.content:
NEW DELHI :
THE bacteria Mycobacterium tuberculosis, which causes the world’s most infectious disease Tuberculosis (TB), can survive antibiotic treatment and live longer by changing their outer fat coating, according to a new study led by researchers... [2721 chars]

articles.title: POSCO Future M Signs MOU with U.S.-based Factorial for All-Solid-State Battery Technology Development
articles.description: POSCO Future M and Factorial signed a Memorandum of Understanding for the development of all-solid-state battery technology.
articles.content: BOSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--POSCO Future M, a leading battery materials supplier, and Factorial Inc. (Factorial), a leader in solid-state battery technology, signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), for the development of all-solid-state battery tech... [3641 chars]
